> After doing some reading I was under the impression that if I went to 
> the below web site and went to the build artifacts and grabed the WAR 
> file, I could just drop it into Tomcat 5.0.28 and it would for the 
> most part work. 
>
> http://crawltools.archive.org:8080/cruisecontrol/buildresults/HEAD-heritrix
>
>
Yes. Thats the impression we're trying to convey.

> The login came up, tried to login and got
>
>java.lang.RuntimeException: No heritrix instance (or multiple to choose from and we haven't implemented this yet)
>
>Looked through the source and noticed that the 
>public static MBeanServer registerMBean   in Heritrix.java is not getting called to create the instance.
>
>From what I gather JMX should be calling this??
>
>In the Heritrix class the docs say Heritrix can also be embedded or 
>launched by webapp initialization
>
>I guess I am missing the initialization step, any help or direction would be apreciated
>, by the way I am using java 1.4.2_06 and get the same error on windows and linux.
>
>  
>
A couple of recent refactorings broke heritrix-as-WAR (Looks like 
heritrix-as-WAR ain't that popular a package or we'd have heard 
complaint before this). 

We weren't registering the Heritrix instance created by the webapp 
lifecycle start so the UI wasn't unable to find the just-created 
Heritrix instance ("No heritrix instance...").  I just fixed this.  I 
also changed the way we do the SinkHandler registration so its no longer 
necessary to put SinkHandler class into commons/endorsed so can be found 
by tomcat when its loading up logging handlers (Build 782+ will have the 
fixes.  See here: 
http://crawltools.archive.org:8080/cruisecontrol/buildresults/HEAD-heritrix).

Seems like above fixes make us work again in tomcat 5.0.28 and in 4.x 
but there is still an issue deploying Heritrix in tomcat-5.5.9 that I 
need to look into.

Yours,
St.Ack
